channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Teen charged with murder of British Indian, 80, at Leicester park
item.description: A 14-year-old boy faces charges for the murder of Bhim Kohli, an 80-year-old British Indian man attacked while walking his dog in Leicester. Kohli died from neck injuries sustained during the assault. Three girls and another boy were also arrested but subsequently released without further police action.
item.dc:creator: NAOMI CANTON

item.title: Mind Games: Putin says he prefers Harris as President as Dems say Moscow manipulating MAGA
item.description: The US Justice Department has charged two Russian media executives with laundering $10 million to fund pro-Moscow propaganda videos distributed by a Tennessee-based company. These videos, which have amassed millions of views, aim to create social divisions in the US and blame Ukraine for the ongoing war with Russia. Moscow dismissed these allegations as nonsense.
item.dc:creator: Chidanand Rajghatta

item.title: Watch: Indian-origin man in Canada arrested after driving stolen SUV over police cars
item.description: Ramanpreet Singh, a 25-year-old man from Brampton, has been charged after allegedly attempting to run over Peel police vehicles in Mississauga on September 3, 2024. Officers were trying to apprehend him while he was driving a stolen Ford Bronco SUV. Singh faces multiple charges and is currently in custody awaiting a bail hearing.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Harvey Weinstein indecent assault charges dropped in UK. Here's why
item.description: British prosecutors have dropped indecent assault charges against Harvey Weinstein, citing no realistic chance of conviction for the alleged 1996 incident in London. Weinstein is already serving a 23-year sentence for rape in the US and has been convicted of another rape case in Los Angeles, resulting in a 16-year sentence.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Don’t know if I'll ever ... ': French woman testifies against husband accused of inviting men to rape
item.description: Gisèle Pélicot, a 70-year-old French woman, testified against her ex-husband Dominique Pélicot and 50 other men charged with raping her over a decade. She was allegedly drugged and raped while unconscious, with the acts filmed. Police uncovered thousands of disturbing photos and videos during a two-year investigation involving 72 suspects.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Fantasy meets reality: Why Chinese women are hiring female cosplayers to play dream men
item.description: In China, 'cos commissioning' is a growing trend where female cosplayers transform into male video game characters and go on dates with their female fans. This practice allows women to design idealized relationships, blending virtual fantasy with reality. It offers emotional satisfaction and challenges traditional dating norms by providing controlled romantic experiences.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US elections: Russian President Putin 'supports' Kamala Harris
item.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin expressed support for Kamala Harris in the upcoming US presidential election during Russia's Eastern Economic Forum. His remarks appeared sarcastic, responding to US accusations of Russian interference. Putin criticized past sanctions by former President Trump and stressed respecting the choice of American voters while noting Harris's contagious laughter.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: South Korea records highest average temperature
item.description: South Korea's average summer temperature hit a record high of 25.6 degrees Celsius, marking the hottest since nationwide observation began in 1973. The country also faced an unprecedented number of tropical nights. Climate change is identified as the cause, leading to a court ruling mandating revised climate goals.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Did Apalachee high school receive shooting threat before mass attack? Georgia official clarify
item.description: A tragic shooting at Apalachee High School in Winder, Georgia, resulted in four deaths and nine injuries. Initial reports of a warning about the attack were debunked by authorities. The investigation is ongoing to determine how 14-year-old Colt Gray obtained and brought an AR-15 rifle into the school.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Apalachee high school tragedy: Georgia shooting claims lives of two students and two teachers — who were the victims?
item.description: A shooting at Apalachee High School in Georgia left two students and two teachers dead. Victims included Mason Schermerhorn, Christian Angulo, Richard Aspinwall, and Christina Irimie. Suspect Colt Gray was apprehended shortly after the incident. Nine others were injured but are expected to recover. Authorities are investigating the motive behind the attack.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: EasyJet flight makes emergency landing after drunk passenger calls captain ‘rubbish', tries to open exit door: Watch video
item.description: An EasyJet flight from London to Greece was forced to make an emergency landing in Munich due to a disruptive passenger. The intoxicated man attempted to storm the cockpit and open an exit door, leading to chaos on board. He was subdued by the crew and passengers before being removed by German police.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Entirely baseless, fabricated': China rejects New Zealand's spy report
item.description: China refuted New Zealand's allegations of foreign interference against its Chinese communities, labeling them as baseless fabrications. The New Zealand Security Intelligence Service expressed ongoing concerns about foreign interference, particularly from China. The Chinese embassy criticized the report for inciting fear and division while underscoring the importance of their bilateral relationship.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Chinese cities suspend schools, cancel flights ahead of super typhoon Yagi
item.description: Southern China has suspended schools and flights as tropical storm Yagi turns into a super typhoon heading towards Hainan. The storm has already caused deadly floods in the Philippines. Hong Kong braces for strong winds, while Vietnam readies its military and coastal measures for Yagi's expected impact.

item.title: UN's Guterres says 'injustices' against Africa must be corrected
item.description: UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres has called for Africa to be granted a permanent seat on the UN Security Council to address historic injustices. Speaking at the China-Africa forum, he noted Africa's debt challenges and praised China's development achievements as a model for sustainable growth and cooperation in trade, technology, and other areas.

item.title: 'Nebraska Walz’s for Trump' shirts spark apostrophe debate on X, social media explodes over grammar fail
item.description: A family photo featuring pro-Trump shirts worn by distant relatives of Kamala's running mate Tim Walz has gone viral due to a grammatical error. The shirts read 'Nebraska Walz’s for Trump,' with an incorrectly placed apostrophe, sparking widespread amusement and criticism online. Grammar enthusiasts quickly pointed out the mistake, turning the political moment into a humorous lesson in punctuation.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Beluga whale Hvaldimir with 'Russian Spy' past allegedly shot: 'Multiple bullet wounds found on body'
item.description: Hvaldimir, a beluga whale with mysterious origins and viral fame in Norway, was found dead on the southwestern coast. Animal rights groups allege he was shot and call for a criminal investigation. Hvaldimir first gained attention in 2019 when he appeared wearing a harness, sparking speculation about his possible ties to the Russian military.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Hunter Biden’s legal troubles intensify: All you need to know about tax trial
item.description: Hunter Biden's tax trial is set to begin in Los Angeles, focusing on charges of tax evasion and filing false returns. The case follows a collapsed plea deal and a previous gun charge conviction. With significant implications for the Biden family, the trial will scrutinize Hunter's financial dealings and personal struggles.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump shouts out Brittany Mahomes, Swifties wonder: What about Taylor?
item.description: Donald Trump acknowledged Brittany Mahomes, wife of Kansas City Chiefs quarterback Patrick Mahomes, on social media after she showed support for him. This has sparked online discussions and contrasts with Taylor Swift's political endorsements. The situation adds a layer of intrigue to their public appearances ahead of the Super Bowl.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Taiwan’s only friend in Africa skips Chinese leader’s big summit
item.description: King Mswati III of Eswatini was absent from Xi Jinping's Forum on China-Africa Cooperation due to Eswatini's diplomatic ties with Taiwan. The kingdom remains Taiwan's sole ally in Africa, resisting China's efforts to isolate Taiwan. Eswatini values Taiwan's support and avoids entanglement in Chinese infrastructure projects and loans.

item.title: Gazan teen musician found new life in playing his oud for children amid war, watch video
item.description: Fifteen-year-old Youssef Saad from Gaza plays his oud for children at a local day centre amid ongoing conflict. Despite losing his home and music school, he remains committed to bringing hope through music. The violence has disrupted many lives, including Saad's family, but he continues to inspire with his dedication.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
